description:
Whalebird has been around for a while. The author updates it regularly and most importantly this client just *feels* very polished.

It's a pleasure to use and I'm delighted to see a real Mastodon desktop client that works great on Linux!
summary: Polished, featureful. Best desktop Mastodon client I've seen

description: App looks and seems fresh and beautiful but on Version 3.2.0 it doesn't allow for me to sign up to any of my accounts on servers running Mastodon v. 2.9.X-3.1.2. Error says: "The requested scope is invalid, unknown, or malformed." However I like it the most from what I have seen from screenshots so far.
summary: Seems like the best client but get error at signup

description: When my host: 'mastodon.host' couldn't be found, I used the default 'mastodon.social' couldn't connect. Waste of time at this point.
summary: Snap version doesn't connect to any host

description: won't open authorisation link in browser, and doesn't display it in app to copy. unable to authorise connection and use app at all
summary: couldn't tell if any good as couldn't get in

description: The app is very well built and I like it a lot. Great job!
Fast, functional and brilliantly well-designed. Props to the developer!
this is not ready for use.
I like this mastodon client but the snap package wont start in Ubuntu 18.04. The AppImage works well as workaround...
summary: snap package wont start (Jan 2020) on Ubuntu 18.04

description:
Utilisation un peu confuse.
Possibilité d'inscrire plusieurs comptes.
Quelques plantages rencontrés.
Entered url, message asks me to login but provides no field for that, next try gives me an error message telling me I should login. Please revise your UX design.
summary: Basic stuff like first login does not work
